intro: Sisymbrium californicum, commonly known as California shepherd's purse, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and medicinal plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and distinctive triangular seed pods that split open when mature. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant gardening.
